title: Bug (?) in godoc
body:
by **gemeu@free.fr**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since the
latest release. Search the issue tracker and check that you're running the
latest version of Go:

Run "go version" and compare against
http://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html  If a newer version of Go exists,
install it and retry what you did to reproduce the problem.

Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1.type ~$godoc godoc
2.
3.

What is the expected output?

A doc on godoc

What do you see instead?

2012/04/24 14:08:55 codewalk.html: line 21: bad directive: {{range .File}

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

6g

Which operating system are you using?

Ubuntu 10.04 LTS Amd64

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

go1

Please provide any additional information below.

The error occurs with go installed from archive go.go1.linux-amd64.tar.gz in user space.
My environment is:

GOROOT=/home/gerard/go
GOPATH=/home/gerard/goPerso
PATH=/home/gerard/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/home/gerard/go/bin:/home/gerard/goPerso/bin

When installed from ppa (in system space), with no GOROOT, the same error occurs, unless
in root mode (with sudo). In the later case the command works fine.

On another (32bits) computer, godoc works fine when installed from
go.go1.linux-386.tar.gz, with the same environment.
